p: Economopoulou and colleagues reported that during the large 2005â€“2006 CHIKV outbreak on the Reunion Island, the proportion of atypical cases (defined as patients with laboratory confirmed CHIKV infection and symptoms other than fever and arthralgia) was 0.3 %; 36% of these atypical cases presented as severe cases, with a mortality of 29% (an overall case-fatality rate of 10. 7%) [ 99].
